name: market for weaned heifers, live weight | weaned heifers, live weight | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/21921/documentation

This is a market activity. Each market represents the consumption mix of a product in a given geography, connecting suppliers with consumers of the same product in the same geographical area. Markets group the producers and also the imports of the product (if relevant) within the same geographical area. They also account for transport to the consumer and for the losses during that process, when relevant.;This is the market for 'weaned heifers, live weight', in the geography of Brazil. This is a constrained market for consequential system model, for attributional system models, this is a regular market. In the case of consequential system model, details about the marginal consumer can be found in the comment of the conditional exchange (by-product).;This market describes the consumption mix of weaned heifers in Brazil. No imports or exports to this market are considered; transport distances model distribution of the weaned heifers within the geographical area of the market, Brazil. The heifers are transported alive, normally to be fattened. This is a constrained market. The justification for a market constraint is included in the comment field of the conditional exchange. ;The product 'weaned heifers, live weight' is an animal farmed for meat. Beef cattle are typically farmed for 1-2 years. A heifer is an adult female bovine that has not yet given birth to a calf. The product represents the animal alive before transferring and processing in a slaughterhouse.

Activity starts with loading the  weaned heifer onto the lorry.

Activity ends with unloading the weaned heifer off the lorry.
